title: What are the different sections in a marching band? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you want to get a little technical, there’s the woodwinds (clarinets, flutes), the brass (tubas, trumpets, baritones), percussion (marimba, quads, drum set), the color guard, and some even have electric basses and guitars. However, we usually just stick with 3 general sections: the pit (marimba, drum set, bass/guitar if they stay off the field), the winds (woodwinds, brass, strings might get thrown in here), and the guard.

So the different sections of the band are Woodwinds (flutes, clarinets and saxophones)high brass (trumpets)low brass (mellophones, sousaphones, bari sax, etc)battery (timpani, snare etc)pit (xylophone, marimba, bells, chimes, etc)color guard (flags, rifles, sabers) Depending on the band, this might be a little different
